intro: Aspilia falconiensis, commonly known as the Falcon Island dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, sunny habitats. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and occur in a single head, surrounded by bracts. Aspilia falconiensis is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its island environment.
